item.title: Reasoning
item.description: Also see distributed computing ref. Correctness Assertion Assertion p: Assume that p is true. In practice, good programmers use special statements to check if assertions are true; eg: Java. Correctness S is correct wrt precondition p and postcondition q if: starting with p true, run S, get q. Partial correctness \(\set{p}S\set{q}\). S is correct wrt p and q if: starting with p true, if ye run S, ye get q if S terminates.
